intro: Pithocarpa corymbulosa, commonly known as the mountain wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. The plant features compound leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in corymbs. Its pithy stems are a distinctive botanical feature, contributing to its common name. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions.
